summary: Can I just I love seeing how big skam has gotten and how often it is trending. It is such a good show and concept and it is...
body:
Can I just I love seeing how big skam has gotten and how often it is trending. It is such a good show and concept and it is wonderful that so many people are seeing it.

I’ve been here since original nooras season and wow to see the way it has grown and that the topics have become so universal for all the remakes. This was one of my first fandoms and 😭😍

tags: me: im not gonna rant todya
summary: honestly why am I seeing posts about how ‘we don’t deserve’ like axel and the guy who plays Italian even because they’re...
question: honestly why am I seeing posts about how ‘we don’t deserve’ like axel and the guy who plays Italian even because they’re discussing their sexualities. Like yeah it’s good about how there are lgbt actors playing lgbt characters but it just seems to me like a way for people to fetishise the actors just as much as they fetishise the characters. Why are the actors’ personal lives even being discussed?
answer:
funny you should mention it because @daphylecomte and i were discussing this earlier today and this is pretty much exactly what we said! like yes, having lgbt+ actors portraying lgbt+ characters is great, as they often can bring something to the character a straight person couldn’t. but like you’re saying, in this particular context it feels like bordering on fetishizing. these are real people, and who they’re into shouldn’t really be a concern of ours.

i want to stress that i don’t think op meant it to be fetishizing, nor the majority of the people who have reblogged it, but that’s the way it came across to me personally and as it seems you too.

reblog.comment:
funny you should mention it because @daphylecomte and i were discussing this earlier today and this is pretty much exactly what we said! like yes, having lgbt+ actors portraying lgbt+ characters is great, as they often can bring something to the character a straight person couldn’t. but like you’re saying, in this particular context it feels like bordering on fetishizing. these are real people, and who they’re into shouldn’t really be a concern of ours.

i want to stress that i don’t think op meant it to be fetishizing, nor the majority of the people who have reblogged it, but that’s the way it came across to me personally and as it seems you too.

trail.content_raw:
funny you should mention it because @daphylecomte and i were discussing this earlier today and this is pretty much exactly what we said! like yes, having lgbt+ actors portraying lgbt+ characters is great, as they often can bring something to the character a straight person couldn’t. but like you’re saying, in this particular context it feels like bordering on fetishizing. these are real people, and who they’re into shouldn’t really be a concern of ours.

i want to stress that i don’t think op meant it to be fetishizing, nor the majority of the people who have reblogged it, but that’s the way it came across to me personally and as it seems you too.
trail.content:
funny you should mention it because @daphylecomte and i were discussing this earlier today and this is pretty much exactly what we said! like yes, having lgbt+ actors portraying lgbt+ characters is great, as they often can bring something to the character a straight person couldn’t. but like you’re saying, in this particular context it feels like bordering on fetishizing. these are real people, and who they’re into shouldn’t really be a concern of ours.

i want to stress that i don’t think op meant it to be fetishizing, nor the majority of the people who have reblogged it, but that’s the way it came across to me personally and as it seems you too.

summary: Does anyone else think that Lucas is going to find out about that Eliott is bipolar a lot sooner that Isak found out about Even?...
body: Does anyone else think that Lucas is going to find out about that Eliott is bipolar a lot sooner that Isak found out about Even? Eliott seems to be struggling and Lucas is beginning to notice - not showing up to paint the common room, admitting to him and Chloe it was becuase there was a problem, Lucille’s comments, poor attendance and not replying to his texts and hearing that he went “crazy” in class. Lucas occasionally replies to his mother’s texts, which suggests he a little closer to her than Isak was to his mother, so maybe is he will be more accepting to Eliott (not saying that Isak wasn’t to Even). I’m just wondering how all of this will impact the story to come. Any thoughts?

reblog.comment: Does anyone else think that Lucas is going to find out about that Eliott is bipolar a lot sooner that Isak found out about Even? I’m just wondering how all of this will impact the story to come. Any thoughts?

blog.name: soyellowcurtainsthen
blog.title: Maybe We're Just Lost Souls
blog.description: Hi, i'm Lauren. I'm 24 from Scotland. The sun's gonna explode someday, and to stave off the bout of existential crisis brought on by that little nugget of information, i pass the time scrolling endlessly through this website. Enjoy the lacklustre attempt at blogging you will find here! Icon credit- @trjeisandvik

tags: im almost incapable of writing happy things
enjoy more angst in this trying time
summary: The hustle and bustle of Lucas’s flatshare is something he isn’t used to. He’s used to quietness so vast and empty that he...
body:
The hustle and bustle of Lucas’s flatshare is something he isn’t used to. He’s used to quietness so vast and empty that he drowns in it. Here though, he can hear the sound of people going about their business just outside the door. It sort of feels comforting, in a way he can’t quite express.


He’s sitting at the window, Lucas fast asleep on the bed. If he is being completely honest he wishes he were as well, but he can’t sleep. All he can do is think.


This is stupid. You’ve been waiting for this to happen for weeks. Why can’t you just stop? He’s here, why can’t you just let it go? He’s too good for you, you know that right? You’re going to mess this up!


It was easier to block those thoughts when he had Lucas’s voice contrasting them. Whispered conversations helping to dull the roaring in his ears. Thoughts an ever loudening noise in the background. Now the quietness eats away at his resolve. Chipping away at the tranquility they had managed to create.


He feels guilty.


The more he thinks about Lucille’s messages, still waiting to be answered, the worse he feels. It’s strange, the guilt crawling it’s way through his veins is not because he still feels about her the same way he did all those years ago. It’s because he doesn’t.


The other part of that guilt is for Lucas.


It’s not going to work. It’s not going to work. It’s not going to work!


It’s jarring that guilt. Makes him feel like a shattered version of himself, glued back together. Jagged edges there for the world to see. He’s scared of him. Scared what giving all of his heart to this boy will do to him.


Nobody ever explained love like this to him.


Painful. Overwhelming. Fragile. Vulnerable.


He’s terrified, absolutely terrified, of pulling all the pieces of himself into the light for Lucas to see.


He won’t be the same after it. He knows that, and that knowledge sits heavy within him. It’s like standing on the edge of a cliff, the drop so far below you can’t see the bottom. It’s like being told to take that jump and knowing at some point that you will. It’s like knowing you should jump because it could be amazing, but not being able to because of the crushing weight of the unknown.


He doesn’t know if he’s ready for that jump.


Not today at least.


He needs the small amount of courage he’s managed to find within himself for something else.


He will jump though. Knows he will when he looks at Lucas lying peacefully on the bed.


He kind of feels like he already has.

He doesn’t know if he’s ready for that jump.


Not today at least.


He needs the small amount of courage he’s managed to find within himself for something else.


He will jump though. Knows he will when he looks at Lucas lying peacefully on the bed.


He kind of feels like he already has.
